intro: Acer fengii, commonly known as the Fengyi maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soils in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and landscaped areas.
